explanation: Agent A is correct. The for statement uses two distinct objects as loop indices (i and j): the loop condition references both (quoted_len > i && unquoted_len > j) and the iteration expression increments both (++i, ++j). MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 requires a single loop counter (initialized in the first clause) and that the third clause may only modify that loop counter. Here j is not the single loop counter (it is initialized outside the first clause) yet is modified in the third clause and used in the second clause, so the for loop is not well-formed under Rule 14.2 and the reported violation is correct.
